reviews.sentence: This place is great and just a short drive to Campus.

Staff was very nice and very helpful. Room was nice with a very comfortable bed very spacious room. Very close to multiple restaurants and some shopping across street as well as Butterfly Pavilion. Within a few miles of Flatirons Shopping CenterParking is across the street which is weird since the hotel is the only thing in the immediate area.

Nice hotel with great mountain views. My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for five nights while in town to visit friends and family. it is conveniently located across the street from lots of restaurants and a movie theater. The lobby is huge and spacious with a ton of seating and a fireplace. there is also a Starbucks booth in the lobby which is convenient in the morning. there is a restaurant in the lobby as well which has a nice bar. The hotel has 14 floors and the west facing rooms offer excellent mountain vistas. The rooms were clean for the most part and the beds were very comfortable. The shower had excellent water temperature and pressure and most importantly drained well. The biggest drawback was parking. Valet charged 10 to park the car overnight. This seemed way too pricey given the hotels suburban location. Also the bathroom did not appear to be cleaned all too thoroughly. The counter looked as if it had just been wiped down and not cleaned properly. There was actually a faint toothpaste mark on the counter when we arrived. Also the bath robe looked dirty so we were unable to use it. The staff was all very attentive helpful and friendly. The biggest issue was when we arrived at our room on Friday night after being out all day only to discover that our room door was not closed all the way. Luckily all of our personal belongings in the room were accounted for but that was still unnerving knowing that our room was unlocked all day. Other than that we had an enjoyable stay. The views the location the lobby the shower the restaurant bar the Starbucks booth the beds. Across the street from restaurants and movie theater. Also near a large park and rec center. The Butterfly pavilion is across the street. More thorough cleaning of the rooms particularly the bathrooms. Cheaper valet service. Ensure that housekeeping completely closes the doors.

Not Worth It. Although the Lobby and Rooms at the Westin Westminster are beautifully appointed we were greatly disappointed by the following. The Starbucks in the Lobby was rarely open. At Hampton Inns one can get coffee and tea 24 hours day. The Kachina Restaurant though delicious food is overpriced and was less than accommodating when we wanted two pots of tea. We were told they were fully booked yet most of the tables were open. The swimming pool water was very cloudy yet full of chlorine. The shower in the womens locker room stayed warm for about 2 minutes then went very cold. There were no hair dryers provided in the locker room and the towels were small. There was only one robe provided in the room we stayed in and it was very wrinkled and looked old. The parking lot is far from the hotel when it is raining and snowing. Valet parking is 10 per night and the valet lot is close to the hotel. The Valet and self park lots should be reversed. Beware of the Room Service bills. Although there is a spot to add a gratuity 22 is already added to the bill for service. The bed was comfortable the room attractive. Convenient to both Boulder and Denver Price Locker Room Pool Maintenance Open Hours of Starbucks Parking Lot.

Room in Disrepair. The toilet ran off and on the entire time. We found a prescription pill on the floor in the bathroom not ours. When we turned on the shower the water sprayed so hard it flooded the floor. Repairs were made to the walls and the mud from the drywall was not cleaned up. We paid for Internet that is fine we knew ahead of time but it was posted 995 daily we were charged 1495. The Starbucks in the lobby had a sign be back at 100 so we had to walk to a local coffee shop which was staffed. Just a very disappointing experience for a Westin. The staff was very friendly the lobby was lovely. The area was great around the hotel nice restaurants easy access to the city. The room was in disrepair.

Very nice acomodations. We stayed 4 nights. We were visiting relatives. We did not use the amenities. We did walk around and looked at what was there. Wish we could have taken advantage of it. We could not figure out how the maid service worked but if we needed something they were right on it. We got double beds why I do not remember but they are too small for 2 adults comfortably. We will definitely stay there again next time we visit. it is in a nice area. it is close to freeways. A pretty easy drive from the airport if you use GPS. Good views from the rooms. Staff was friendly. Nice outside areas. A pond and promenade is right on the property with nice sidewalks and a pedestrian bridge. there is a theatre and comedy club there among other things.

The hotel has easy access from the 36 and nice restaurants inside and nearby. The rooms are big. They even offer free bottled water. Good happy hour specials. The complimentary robe in the room had a few too many stains. The cord on the cofemaker was showing open wires. The housekeeping staff are quick but noisy. The bar staff needs to remember their paying customers come before their friends.

WARNING WARNING. If I could rate this hotel a 0 or a negative score I would. We stayed at this hotel the day after 4th of July and arrived later in the evening. I went to the room first because I was very ill and my wife went shopping before the stores closed. I had gone strait to bed when I walked into the room without looking at the bathroom so when my wife came back she came to see that the bathroom was absolutely disgusting. Pubic hair all over the bathroom shower floor and hair on the sink. The worst was their was remnants of what looked like blood on the toilet seat and was un cleaned. My wife took pictures of the room that night and I will post them on Facebok for everyone to see. We asked that we be refunded the room fair and the hotel agreed the next day to cancel the charges after they first gave us a lame excuse that since we pre booked the room they could not refund the charge. When I received my credit card statement we were in fact charged for the room. My wife and I made several attempts to leave messages with several people including the manager who runs the entire hotel with not a single call back. Stay away from this hotel if you do not want to run into situations and dishonest people as we did. WATCH OUT.
Family Reunion. Great room with view of front range tall cielings and window. Bed was luxiorious. Restaurant was excellent. Pool was cold and hot tub was small for size of hotel.

Enjoyable Place to stay. We really liked the hotel. The view was a gorgeous view of the mountains the bar was a good place to unwind after traveling all day and beds were comfortable. Unfortunately the shower in our room was not amazing and would not turn off all the way after showering.

Decent stay. Hotel was under remodel work but I was not overly disturbed by this. I am a clean freak and the room could have been cleaner. Was n’t terrible but for a higher end establishment it should be perfect.

Nice hotel with some technical difficulties. During our stay the Westin seemed to be undergoing renovations. The lobby was in disarray with furniture partially assembled boxes and tarps in various configuration. Carpet was being worked on and various areas bring painted. The pool was closed disappointing. Our room was clean and comfortable with a nice view of the mountains. However upon arrival we found that both our phone and the remote were dead which makes ordering room service and watching TV challenging. The engineer switched out the phone and remote but neither the new phone nor the new remote whether either very odd. The TV took forever to switch channels and sometimes got no signal at all. Internet fees are per day and are in the 10 15 range for 5 devices expensive. The fitness center was nice however the Lifetime Fitness treadmills and elipticals did not have working TVs which made for boring cardio. The staff was nice but I got the impression they did not seem to recognize that people stay in hotels like the Westin because they want a relaxing high end experience not to be trouble shooting technical problems as the staff shrugs. The Westin has the potential to deliver this experience if management can get all these issues better in hand.

Great stay. The hotel was working on a remodel when we arrived. It did not bother me at all as the staff was very courteous and friendly. Our bed was out of this world comfortable as well. We also ate in the restaurant and the food was terrific. Also as we were part of a conference we had additional food which I expected to be average but I was pleasantly surprised at the amazing food including desserts. Thank you Westin for a great three night. Very very impressed staff and comfort You are 25 30 minutes from Boulder or Denver or the airport so you have many options.

Pleasant Hotel with great service. Since this is not the proverbial cheap hotel there had better be some extra effort into making it a grand experience. Not sure I would say it was a grand experience but it was certainly a pleasant experience. We were there for a conference and I will say that the staff here make our time most enjoyable. They were pleasant hard working and efficient. As for the rooms they were very comfortable and clean. The beds and linens were great and the view from our room looked to the mountains. The restaurant attached to the hotel was quite good would recommend. Not sure why at the price of the room that Wifi is not included. This would be enough for me to book somewhere else.

Very Disappointed. Check in at 3 pm was delayed until almost 430. Employee at check in desk offered us a 40 room credit to use in the restaurant. We charged 38 to the room and the charge showed up on my credit card. I called the hotel but since I do not know the name of the employee who offered the credit they will not honor it. We had supper plans at a local restaurant and would not have wasted our money at a hotel bar. Second issue was the A C in the room. When we entered the room it was 72 degrees so I set the thermostat to 66 degrees and we left for a couple hours. When we returned it was 71 degrees. The cooling unit ran all night and lowered the temperature to 70 degrees. When I called the front desk I was told that the maintenance department would contact me ASAP. We never heard from maintenance.

Bathroom door needed attention. The bathroom door would not close but would jam into the frame. If it was not jammed into the frame it would swing open squeaking loudly all the way. When it was fully open it blocked the room door. We left without jamming the door to keep it closed. When we returned we had to reach in the barely open door and push the bathroom door out of the way in order to get in the room. A minor thing but come on folks.

Hotel room shuffle. First room we checked into had a leaky toilet and TV was n’t working. Maintenance was n’t able to fix right away and after complaining we were moved to another room which was fine however the inconvenience was annoying for sure. Maintenance folks were fixing floor just off the elevator which should have been done early in the morning however not in the middle of the day too much traffic. Overall it was a decent hotel I expected a bit more.

I recently attended a 3 day conference here. To all the nursing mamas please know that The Westin is not designated breast feeding friendly. There is no designated room to pump. At first the staff offered me to use the staff bathroom. Um NO not happening. That is disgusting. Staff reluctantly allowed me to use an office and were rude and made me feel uncomfortable by asking how long I needed to pump for and how often. since this was such an inconvenience. The next day they had me use a small closet where contractors left all of their equipment. It was dirty and dusty. Next they offered to let me use the massage room located in the spa on the second floor. They lost the keys and would not let me in. I finally found the maintenance supervisor who let me in. Pump in the dark. Well sure since there were no lights in the massage room. you have got to be kidding me. For a conference center hotel to not have a designated clean room to pump. you have got to be kidding.

I recently attended a 3 day conference here. To all the nursing mamas please know that The Westin is not designated breast feeding friendly. There is no designated room to pump. At first the staff offered me to use the staff bathroom. Um NO not happening. That is disgusting. Staff reluctantly allowed me to use an office and were rude and made me feel uncomfortable by asking how long I needed to pump for and how often. since this was such an inconvenience. The next day they had me use a small closet where contractors left all of their equipment. It was dirty and dusty. Next they offered to let me use the massage room located in the spa on the second floor. They lost the keys and would not let me in. I finally found the maintenance supervisor who let me in. Pump in the dark. Well sure since there were no lights in the massage room. you have got to be kidding me. For a conference center hotel to not have a designated clean room to pump. you have got to be kidding.

The stay as a whole was very good. Location was great and we felt safe. The facility was better than we expected. When we booked the rooms it was still being advertised as having free breakfast but that was not the case. One criteria for where we stayed was a free breakfast and that was a big let down.

If you are looking for a staycation or a place close to downtown with a view and amazing amenities as well as customer service then this hotel is the place to try. My kidos and I have season passes to Elitchs but we live up north. One night we stayed late at Elitchs and we did n’t feel like driving all the way back home so we looked at Priceline and happened upon this hotel. What a lucky find. Upon arrival we did valet parking because the closet parking was a good hike from the hotel. Everyone there from the valet to front desk were incredibly welcoming. We got our keys and went to the room and it was amazing. Huge super soft and cozy beds with enormous vaulted ceilings. They had some lavender oil laid out which we all love and was the perfect touch of relaxation to wind down to. We all slept very well and actually ended up staying another time since then and got a suite on the top floor with incredible views. There is a beautiful courtyard and great restaurant at the hotel as well. The second time we also walked across the way to Dave and Busters for some great fun too. We will be looking to book a suite again soon for my sons 13th birthday celebration. Whether in town on vacation staycation or business this hotel has it all.
Everything is good except for wifi the guest wifi they offer is too slow that you can not use it for anything. It is so frustrating when you have to use it for work.
Cause we were the guest of the day and got a mountin floor on thr 12 floor yet.

Not worth the price. it was pretty on the outside but you get inside it was very average. The best part of the hotel was Chanel in the coffee shop. She was FANTASTIC1 a day for WiFi. ridiculous. Should be includedRust in the sink. grosShower was too small for a ‘ rain head’Ice machine was outNot enough parking unles you used valetGot rid of the hot tub. ugh.

Not worth the price. it was pretty on the outside but you get inside it was very average. The best part of the hotel was Chanel in the coffee shop. She was FANTASTIC1 a day for WiFi. ridiculous. Should be includedRust in the sink. grosShower was too small for a ‘ rain head’Ice machine was outNot enough parking unles you used valetGot rid of the hot tub. ugh.
Grwat room. The reception on the television sucks. For the price u would think u would be able to relax and enjoy a little down time.

Expect to Pay if you Want Convenient Parking. While I loved the hotel I was less than impressed with the service particularly the parking. When I first arrived it appeared that you could only park in front of the hotel if you were planning on using the valet even if you were just checking in. Not wanting to have my car moved before I could check in I decided to park first only to find out that the parking lot was across the street and it was full. The overflow parking was down the block which would mean I would have to haul my luggage from a distance. So I decided to valet only to be charged a fee of 15 for overnight valet parking. Then when I came for my car the next morning it took them 15 minutes to bring me my car. Although this may not seem like a big deal I was late for my nephews graduation because I never thought I would need to schedule in that much wait time for my car especially with only one other person waiting before me. I brought my concern to the front desk but a stale I apologize. is all I received felt insincere.

A Wannabe Vegas Hotel. This looks like a Vegas like hotel but is missing two important factors customer service and quality. Wrong room was given from our reservation. Room and hallway was dirty. Carpet is torn up. Trash left everywhere especially by the elevators saw housekeeping walk right past it. Manager was an a hole. Ice machine did nt work. Wallpaper peeling in hallway and rooms. Not enough parking especially disabled parking. This is a nice hotel if you do nt look too close and do nt interact with any staff.

I took my kids here for a mini weekend with dad because I saw there was an indoor pool and the Westin was known for being a nice place. The hotel was nice but when we went to the pool it was iced cold like hyperventilating cold. When we told the front desk we were told they notified the engineer to “ turn on the heat ” but it would be heated soon. We came back a few hours later to the same iced pool. When we told the front desk there reason was too bad and that we could come back closer to midnight. I had two young children with me the front desk did not even apologize for our inconvenience. The next day we came back and it was equally cold. Since this hotel does not have a hot tub you would assume they would try to have a heated pool. My biggest issue was with the front desk complete lack of care with an upset family.

Recent stay. Stayed there several times. This year showers seemed to be not that hot probably because they were busy. The beds have been good in past this year it was either the bed or pillows that did not allow for good sleep. They did move our room at our request so that was good. The hotel lobby is very nice. Front desk is great too.
